sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The tocsin, or watch-bell sent to the king, queene regent, princes of blood, to all the parlaments, magistrates, officers, and loyall subiects of France. Against the booke of the popes temporall power, not long since set forth by Cardinall Bellarmine Iesuite. By Memnons Statue. With the permission of the best genie of Fraunce. And done into English by I.R. ... Tocsin au roy. English Le Jay, Nicolas. I. R., fl. 1611. France. Parliament (Paris)
[80] p.
Printed [by W. Stansby] for Edward White the younger, and are to be sold at the little North doore of Paules, at the signe of the Gunne, London : 1611.
Memnons Statue = Nicolas Le Jay. A translation, by I.R., of: Le Jay, Nicolas. Le tocsin au roy, which is a response to the "Tractatus de potestate summi pontificis in temporalibus, adversus Guilielmu Barclaium" of Roberto Bellarmino. Includes "An extract of the registers of the Court of the Parliament of Paris" which has a separate dated title page (register is continuous). Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-H⁴ (H4 blank). Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
The tocsin, or watch-bell sent to the king, queene regent, princes of blood, to all the parlaments, magistrates, officers, and loyall subiects of France. Against the booke of the popes temporall power, not long since set forth by Cardinall Bellarmine Iesuite. By Memnons Statue. With the permission of the best genie of Fraunce. And done into English by I.R. ... Tocsin au roy. English Le Jay, Nicolas. I. R., fl. 1611. France. Parliament (Paris)
[80] p.
Printed [by W. Stansby] for Edward White the younger, and are to be sold at the little North doore of Paules, at the signe of the Gunne, London : 1611.
Memnons Statue = Nicolas Le Jay. A translation, by I.R., of: Le Jay, Nicolas. Le tocsin au roy, which is a response to the "Tractatus de potestate summi pontificis in temporalibus, adversus Guilielmu Barclaium" of Roberto Bellarmino. Includes "An extract of the registers of the Court of the Parliament of Paris" which has a separate dated title page (register is continuous). Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-H⁴ (H4 blank). Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Edward White the younger
W. Stansby]
the little North doore of Paules, at the signe of the Gunne
